00030 #define XNTIMER_WHEELSIZE 64
00031 #define XNTIMER_WHEELMASK (XNTIMER_WHEELSIZE - 1)
00032 
00033 /* Timer status */
00034 #define XNTIMER_DEQUEUED  0x00000001
00035 #define XNTIMER_KILLED    0x00000002
00036 
00037 /* These flags are available to the real-time interfaces */
00038 #define XNTIMER_SPARE0  0x01000000
00039 #define XNTIMER_SPARE1  0x02000000
00040 #define XNTIMER_SPARE2  0x04000000
00041 #define XNTIMER_SPARE3  0x08000000
00042 #define XNTIMER_SPARE4  0x10000000
00043 #define XNTIMER_SPARE5  0x20000000
00044 #define XNTIMER_SPARE6  0x40000000
00045 #define XNTIMER_SPARE7  0x80000000
00046 
00047 #define XNTIMER_LOPRIO  (-999999999)
00048 #define XNTIMER_STDPRIO 0
00049 #define XNTIMER_HIPRIO  999999999
00050 
00051 #define XNTIMER_KEEPER_ID 0

00053 typedef struct {
00054         xnholder_t link;
00055         xnticks_t key;
00056         int prio;
00057 
00058 #define link2tlholder(ln)       container_of(ln, xntlholder_t, link)
00059 
00060 } xntlholder_t;
00061 
00062 #define xntlholder_date(h)      ((h)->key)
00063 #define xntlholder_prio(h)      ((h)->prio)
00064 #define xntlholder_init(h)      inith(&(h)->link)
00065 #define xntlist_init(q) initq(q)
00066 #define xntlist_head(q)                 \
00067         ({ xnholder_t *_h = getheadq(q);        \
00068                 !_h ? NULL : link2tlholder(_h); \
00069         })
00070 
00071 static inline void xntlist_insert(xnqueue_t *q, xntlholder_t *holder)
00072 {
00073         xnholder_t *p;
00074 
00075         /* Insert the new timer at the proper place in the single
00076            queue managed when running in aperiodic mode. O(N) here,
00077            but users of the aperiodic mode need to pay a price for the
00078            increased flexibility... */
00079 
00080         for (p = q->head.last; p != &q->head; p = p->last)
00081                 if (holder->key > link2tlholder(p)->key ||
00082                     (holder->key == link2tlholder(p)->key &&
00083                      holder->prio <= link2tlholder(p)->prio))
00084                         break;
00085 
00086         insertq(q,p->next,&holder->link);
00087 }
00088 
00089 #define xntlist_remove(q, h)  removeq((q),&(h)->link)
00090

00111 typedef xntlholder_t xntimerh_t;
00112 
00113 #define xntimerh_date(h)       xntlholder_date(h)
00114 #define xntimerh_prio(h)       xntlholder_prio(h)
00115 #define xntimerh_init(h)       xntlholder_init(h)
00116 
00117 typedef struct {
00118         unsigned date_shift;
00119         unsigned long long next_shot;
00120         unsigned long long shot_wrap;
00121         xnqueue_t bucket[XNTIMER_WHEELSIZE];
00122 } xntimerq_t;
00123 
00124 static inline void xntimerq_init(xntimerq_t *q)
00125 {
00126         unsigned long long step_tsc;
00127         unsigned i;
00128 
00129         step_tsc = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_XENO_OPT_TIMER_WHEEL_STEP);
00130         /* q->date_shift = fls(step_tsc); */
00131         for (q->date_shift = 0; (1 << q->date_shift) < step_tsc; q->date_shift++)
00132                 ;
00133         q->next_shot = q->shot_wrap = ((~0ULL) >> q->date_shift) + 1;
00134         for (i = 0; i < sizeof(q->bucket)/sizeof(xnqueue_t); i++)
00135                 xntlist_init(&q->bucket[i]);
00136 }
00137 
00138 #define xntimerq_destroy(q)    do { } while (0)
00139 
00140 static inline xntlholder_t *xntimerq_head(xntimerq_t *q)
00141 {
00142         unsigned bucket = ((unsigned) q->next_shot) & XNTIMER_WHEELMASK;
00143         xntlholder_t *result;
00144         unsigned i;
00145 
00146         if (q->next_shot == q->shot_wrap)
00147                 return NULL;
00148 
00149         result = xntlist_head(&q->bucket[bucket]);
00150 
00151         if (result && (xntlholder_date(result) >> q->date_shift) == q->next_shot)
00152                 return result;
00153 
00154         /* We could not find the next timer in the first bucket, iterate over
00155            the other buckets. */
00156         for (i = (bucket + 1) & XNTIMER_WHEELMASK ;
00157              i != bucket; i = (i + 1) & XNTIMER_WHEELMASK) {
00158                 xntlholder_t *candidate = xntlist_head(&q->bucket[i]);
00159 
00160                 if(++q->next_shot == q->shot_wrap)
00161                         q->next_shot = 0;
00162 
00163                 if (!candidate)
00164                         continue;
00165 
00166                 if ((xntlholder_date(candidate) >> q->date_shift) == q->next_shot)
00167                         return candidate;
00168 
00169                 if (!result
00170                     || xntlholder_date(candidate) < xntlholder_date(result))
00171                         result = candidate;
00172         }
00173 
00174         if (result)
00175                 q->next_shot = (xntlholder_date(result) >> q->date_shift);
00176         else
00177                 q->next_shot = q->shot_wrap;
00178         return result;
00179 }
00180 
00181 static inline void xntimerq_insert(xntimerq_t *q, xntimerh_t *h)
00182 {
00183         unsigned long long shifted_date = xntlholder_date(h) >> q->date_shift;
00184         unsigned bucket = ((unsigned) shifted_date) & XNTIMER_WHEELMASK;
00185 
00186         if (shifted_date < q->next_shot)
00187                 q->next_shot = shifted_date;
00188         xntlist_insert(&q->bucket[bucket], h);
00189 }
00190 
00191 static inline void xntimerq_remove(xntimerq_t *q, xntimerh_t *h)
00192 {
00193         unsigned long long shifted_date = xntlholder_date(h) >> q->date_shift;
00194         unsigned bucket = ((unsigned) shifted_date) & XNTIMER_WHEELMASK;
00195 
00196         xntlist_remove(&q->bucket[bucket], h);
00197         /* Do not attempt to update q->next_shot, xntimerq_head will recover. */
00198 }

00220 typedef struct xntimer {
00221 
00222         xntimerh_t aplink;      /* Link in aperiodic timers list. */
00223 
00224 #define aplink2timer(ln)        container_of(ln, xntimer_t, aplink)
00225 
00226 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_TIMING_PERIODIC
00227         xntbase_t *base;        /* Time base. */
00228 
00229         xntlholder_t plink;     /* Link in periodic timers wheel. */
00230 
00231 #define plink2timer(ln) container_of(ln, xntimer_t, plink)
00232 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_TIMING_PERIODIC */
00233 
00234         xnflags_t status;       /* !< Timer status. */
00235 
00236         xnticks_t interval;     /* !< Periodic interval (in ticks, 0 == one shot). */
00237 
00238         struct xnsched *sched;  /* !< Sched structure to which the timer is
00239                                    attached. */
00240 
00241         void (*handler)(struct xntimer *timer); /* !< Timeout handler. */
00242 
00243         XNARCH_DECL_DISPLAY_CONTEXT();
00244 
00245 } xntimer_t;

00247 typedef struct xntimed_slave {
00248 
00249         xntbase_t base;         /* !< Cascaded time base. */
00250 
00251         struct percpu_cascade {
00252                 xntimer_t timer; /* !< Cascading timer in master time base. */
00253                 xnqueue_t wheel[XNTIMER_WHEELSIZE]; 
00254         } cascade[XNARCH_NR_CPUS];
00255 
00256 #define timer2slave(t) \
00257     ((xntslave_t *)(((char *)t) - offsetof(xntslave_t, cascade[xnsched_cpu((t)->sched)].timer)))
00258 #define base2slave(b) \
00259     ((xntslave_t *)(((char *)b) - offsetof(xntslave_t, base)))
00260 
00261 } xntslave_t;

00275                 unsigned prio = (p);                            \
00276                 xntimerh_prio(&(_t)->aplink) = prio;            \

00278         })
00279 #else /* !CONFIG_XENO_OPT_TIMING_PERIODIC */
00280 #define xntimer_set_priority(t,p)                               \
00281         do { xntimerh_prio(&(t)->aplink) = (p); } while(0)

00284 static inline int xntimer_active_p (xntimer_t *timer)
00285 {
00286         return timer->sched != NULL;
00287 }
00288 
00289 static inline int xntimer_running_p (xntimer_t *timer)
00290 {
00291         return !testbits(timer->status,XNTIMER_DEQUEUED);
00292 }

00359 static inline int xntimer_start(xntimer_t *timer,
00360                                 xnticks_t value, xnticks_t interval,
00361                                 int mode)
00362 {
00363         return timer->base->ops->start_timer(timer, value, interval, mode);
00364 }
00365 
00391 static inline void xntimer_stop(xntimer_t *timer)
00392 {
00393         /* Careful: the do_timer_stop() helper is expected to preserve
00394            the date field of the stopped timer, so that subsequent
00395            calls to xntimer_get_timeout() would still work on such
00396            timer as expected. */
00397         if (!testbits(timer->status,XNTIMER_DEQUEUED))
00398                 timer->base->ops->stop_timer(timer);
00399 }
00400 
00433 static inline xnticks_t xntimer_get_date(xntimer_t *timer)
00434 {
00435         if (!xntimer_running_p(timer))
00436                 return XN_INFINITE;
00437 
00438         return timer->base->ops->get_timer_date(timer);
00439 }
00440 
00475 static inline xnticks_t xntimer_get_timeout(xntimer_t *timer)
00476 {
00477         if (!xntimer_running_p(timer))
00478                 return XN_INFINITE;
00479 
00480         return timer->base->ops->get_timer_timeout(timer);
00481 }

00560 static inline void xntimer_stop(xntimer_t *timer)
00561 {
00562         if (!testbits(timer->status,XNTIMER_DEQUEUED))
00563                 xntimer_stop_aperiodic(timer);
00564 }
